text: David Arends Gieseker (born 23 November 1943 in Oakland, California)biographical information from American Men and Women of Science, Thomson Gale 2004 is an American mathematician, specializing in algebraic geometry. Gieseker received his bachelor's degree in 1965 from Reed College and his master's degree from Harvard University in 1967. In 1970 he received his Ph.D. under Robin Hartshorne with thesis Contributions to the Theory of Positive Embeddings in Algebraic Geometry. Gieseker became a professor at the University of California, Los Angeles in 1975. The topics of his research include geometric invariant theory and moduli of vector bundles over algebraic curves. ==Selected publications== ===Articles=== *with Spencer Bloch: * * * * *with Jun Li: *with Jun Li: ===Books=== *Lectures on moduli of curves, Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, Springer Verlag 1982; notes by D. R. Gokhale *with Eugene Trubowitz and Horst Knörrer: Geometry of algebraic Fermi curves, Academic Press 1992 ==References== ==External links== *New Developments in Stability and Moduli, Conference in Honor of the 68th Birthday of David Gieseker, July 18–23, 2011, Hang-Zhou and Li Jiang, China Category:1943 births Category:Living people Category:20th-century American mathematicians Category:21st-century American mathematicians Category:Reed College alumni Category:Harvard University alumni Category:University of California, Los Angeles faculty
title: David Gieseker
